title: 'Legend' Calipari leads Razorbacks into Sweet 16
content: John Calipari is heading to the Sweet 16 for the 16th time, guiding the Razorbacks past nemesis Rick Pitino and second-seeded St. John's 75-66 to bring his fourth school to the NCAA tournament's second week.

title: Pitino defends benching Luis in loss to Arkansas
content: St. John's coach Rick Pitino defended benching star RJ Luis Jr. for the final 4:56 of Saturday's 75-66 loss to Arkansas.

title: With LeBron back, Lakers lose, eye strong finish
content: The Lakers were whole for the first time in weeks Saturday, but the long-awaited return of LeBron James from a strained left groin couldn't prevent Los Angeles from posting a 146-115 blowout loss to the Chicago Bulls, an effort that dropped them to 43-27.

title: Orioles SS Henderson remains out, to go on IL
content: Orioles shortstop Gunnar Henderson will begin the season on the injured list, general manager Mike Elias announced.

title: Piastri wins Chinese GP, leads McLaren 1-2 finish
content: Oscar Piastri beat teammate Lando Norris to victory at the Chinese Grand Prix as McLaren continued to look a cut above the competition at the second round of the new Formula 1 season.

title: Hendrickson stuns Steveson to win wrestling title
content: Oklahoma State's Wyatt Hendrickson stunned Olympic gold medalist Gable Steveson 5-4 in the heavyweight final Saturday night at the NCAA men's wrestling championships, which Penn State won for a fourth straight time.

title: U.S. runner wins silver in return from burrito ban
content: Shelby Houlihan returned to the big stage after a much-debated four-year doping ban and won a silver medal in the 3,000 meters at the world indoor championships.

title: UVA swimmers tie record with fifth straight title
content: Virginia's Gretchen Walsh and Claire Curzan set NCAA records on their way to individual titles, helping the Cavaliers cruise to their record-tying fifth straight women's swimming and diving championship.

title: Your guide to men's March Madness second round: Results, analysis, keys to Sweet 16
content: Whether you watched all, part or none of Saturday's games -- our team has you covered with what to know.

title: NHL playoff watch: Ranking the top Stanley Cup contenders
content: Will the Lightning, Knights (8 p.m., ESPN+) meet again in the Final? Plus, full playoff projections and more.

title: From 1 to 32: Ranking every team left in women’s March Madness
content: Which 1-seed got passed by UConn? UCLA or South Carolina for No. 1 overall? We rank the 32 teams that advanced.

title: What the rest of MLB can learn from the Royals' old-school rotation
content: Five guys day in and day out? Sounds like a bygone era. But it worked big-time for the Royals last year.

title: Yes, USMNT fans: It's time to worry about the 2026 World Cup
content: The U.S. national team and coach Mauricio Pochettino are running out of time to fix what's wrong before the World Cup -- and there's a lot wrong.

title: Poch: USMNT faces test of 'character' vs. Canada
content: USMNT coach Mauricio Pochettino said that Sunday's third-place game in the Concacaf Nations League against Canada is a match where "we need to show character."

title: Ronaldo: 'No problem' with Højlund's 'Siu' celeb
content: Cristiano Ronaldo said he has "no problem" with Rasmus Højlund performing his famed "Siu" celebration after scoring in Denmark's win over Portugal on Thursday.

title: Ex-France star Ribery: Leg was nearly amputated
content: Former Bayern Munich and France winger Franck Ribery has revealed that he almost had his leg amputated towards the end of his career after surgery on his knee.

title: Tuchel: Bellingham doing 'too much' for England
content: England midfielder Jude Bellingham needs to be a bit more disciplined so that he can have the maximum impact when it counts most, manager Thomas Tuchel said.

title: 3 points and a proposal! Madsen's dream return
content: Everton's Rikke Madsen had a memorable return to action after more than a year, capping off her comeback with a surprise on-pitch proposal from her boyfriend Martin Thomsen.

title: Wrexham boost promotion hopes with 1-0 win
content: Wrexham made progress in their hunt for automatic promotion from League One on Saturday as they moved into second place with a 1-0 win over 10-man Stockport County.

title: Scaloni on Argentina win: No Messi? No problem
content: Argentina coach Lionel Scaloni said Friday's win over Uruguay showed their depth after Lautaro Martínez, Lionel Messi and Paulo Dybala all missed out.

title: Road to men's Frozen Four: What the 16-team field looks like
content: Conference champs have been crowned, and the teams that will fill out the men's hockey bracket are set.

title: It wasn't his behavior, but this Stanford program belongs to Andrew Luck
content: Right now, all of Stanford's trust is in Luck. It's his program now, and that means Troy Taylor is his coach.

title: George Foreman beat time by going from humiliation to vindication
content: Boxing is full of guys who fought past their primes. What Foreman pulled off was something entirely different.

title: Grading MLB's City Connect uniforms: Nats' second set doesn't live up to the first
content: From the pastel Padres to the Motor City Tigers and beyond, we break down MLB's City Connect uniforms.

title: Transfer rumors, news: No way back for Rashford at Man United
content: Marcus Rashford has no future at Manchester United once his loan at Aston Villa expires at the end of the season. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Fine rice to ration card holders in Telangana from Ugadi
content: The distribution would cover 84% of Telangana population where every person in the eligible families would get 6 kg of rice every month

title: TNPDCL bought power at a cost of ₹7,953 crore from exchanges in 2023-24
content: The corporation was a major buyer of electricity from the High Price Day Ahead Market in power exchanges, according to data shared in the report on the short-term power market in India 2023-24, released by the Central Electricity Regulatory Commission

title: More questions arise out of Delhi Chief Justice’s report on ‘sacks of cash’ at judge’s house
content: The published records show the Police Commissioner got in touch with Delhi High Court Chief Justice D.K. Upadhyaya only at around 4.50 p.m. on March 15 when the fire had broken out at Justice Yashwant Varma’s residence at about 11.30 p.m. the previous night. The documents do not reveal the identity of who took the videos and photographs showing the burnt residues of what may be currency notes and whether the police sealed the room immediately.

title: Integrated bus terminal to come up at site of demolished KSRTC garage-cum-administrative block
content: Both KSRTC and private buses will operate from the proposed terminal, designed similarly to the 26-acre Vyttila Mobility Hub, where separate bus bays are allocated for them

title: 20% export duty on onion scrapped, farmers’ organisation asks for long-term policy
content: Kisan Sabha has urged the government to avoid irregular export bans and export restrictions, and to instead take steps to formulate a long-term export policy

title: ASHAs to hold mass hunger strike on March 24
content: ASHAs in Kerala are protesting for better pay and benefits, leading to mass hunger strike and political tensions

title: Notorious drug trafficker Jaggu Bhagwanpuria shifted to Central Jail in Assam
content: Jaggu Bhagwanpuria is believed to have continued to orchestrate criminal activities from within Bathinda Central Jail, reportedly using smuggled mobile phones and a loyal network of associates

title: National Consultation in Bengaluru addresses gender disparity in India’s higher judiciary
content: The event brought together retired judges, legal professionals, scholars, and civil society representatives to confront systemic barriers impeding women’s advancement in India’s judiciary, where representation remains alarmingly low

title: Encounter In J&K After Soldiers Intercept Fresh Infiltrators, Girl Injured
content: A gun battle has erupted in Kathua in Jammu and Kashmir. The encounter started after security forces intercepted a fresh group of infiltrators.

title: "Yeshu Yeshu Prophet" Seen Hitting Man, Woman In Shocking CCTV Footage
content: Weeks after Punjab Police registered a sexual harassment case against self-styled pastor Bajinder Singh, a chilling video of him assaulting a man and a woman in his office has emerged

title: 'Will Invite IndiGo Staff For Dinner And...': Harsha Bhogle's Dig At Airline
content: Cricket commentator Harsha Bhogle on Sunday took a swipe at IndiGo over what he claimed was the airline's "passenger last" and "rude" attitude.

title: Drugs Craving, No Conversations: Meerut Murder Accused's Days In Prison
content: Muskaan Rastogi and her lover Sahil Shukla, accused of brutally murdering her husband Saurabh Rajput and hiding his body parts in a cement-sealed drum, wanted to stay together in jail but were told this was not possible

title: What Tech Mahindra Said On Indian Employee Detained In Qatar For 3 Months
content: IT services firm Tech Mahindra on Sunday said it was in "close contact" with the family of its employee who has been allegedly detained in Qatar in connection with an ongoing investigation.

title: Indian Man, Daughter Killed In US Store Shooting, Left Gujarat 6 Years Back
content: A 24-year-old Indian woman and her 56-year-old father were shot dead at a departmental store in Virginia, US, where they had been working. The shooting took place on Thursday, shortly after the store in Accomack County opened.

title: IPL Live: Noor Ahmad, Khaleel Ahmed Help CSK Restrict MI To 155/9
content: Chennai Super Kings vs Mumbai Indians LIVE Score, IPL 2025 LIVE: CSK's Noor Ahmed and Khaleel Ahmed together broke the spine of MI as the latter team was restricted to 155 for 9

title: Mumbai Cops' Actions In Sushant Singh Case Raised 'Suspicion': Ex-Bihar DGP
content: After the CBI reportedly filed a closure report on actor Sushant Singh Rajput's death case, former Bihar DGP Gupteshwar Pandey criticized the Mumbai Police's handling of the case.

title: Dhoni Turns Back The Clock, Dismisses SKY With Stunning Stumping - Video
content: MS Dhoni left everyone stunned with a brilliant stumping to dismiss Suryakumar Yadav during the IPL 2025 encounter between Chennai Super Kings and Mumbai Indians.

title: Former US Attorney, Who Quit After Trump Took Office, Found Dead At Home
content: Jessica Aber was nominated as the United States Attorney for the Eastern District of Virginia by Joe Biden in 2021.

title: Why Pune Man Regrets Moving To Bengaluru Despite 40% Salary Hike
content: A corporate employee moved from Pune to Bengaluru for a lucrative 40 per cent salary, only to regret his decision within a year. His story was shared by a friend in a now-viral LinkedInpost.

title: Ishan Kishan Scripts History, Achieves Never-Done-Before IPL Feat For SRH
content: Ishan Kishan left everyone stunned with his sensational batting display as the ignored Indian cricket team batter slammed a 45-ball century for Sunrisers Hyderabad during the IPL 2025 match against Rajasthan Royals.

title: "Hateful, Violent": Tesla Cybertrucks Vandalised During Mardi Gras Parade
content: This incident is part of a larger trend of attacks on Tesla facilities and vehicles across the US, with some incidents involving vandalism, graffiti, and even shootings.

title: Blog: Adolescence: Are You A 'Docile Body' Too
content: The characters of this Netflix hit are not simply participants in a system; they are its products. They are what philosopher Michel Foucault called 'docile bodies'.

title: IPL excitement palpable in Vizag as stage is set for first match between DC and LSG on March 24
content: ACA and VDCA officials leave no stone unturned to ensure hassle-free arrangements, right from crowd management to player facilities; Governor Abdul Nazeer gives his consent to attend the event, says ACA president Sivanath

title: No calls were made to over Aaditya’s ‘role’ in Disha Salian case: Sanjay Raut
content: Shiv Sena (UBT) leader accuses BJP of playing politics with the dead after Narayan Rane claimed Uddhav had reached out to with him with a request to conceal his son’s involvement

title: Temple chariot tragedy: 16-year-old girl succumbs to  injuries
content: Jyothi was watching the procession sitting in an autorickshaw, when the 100-feet-high chariot headed for Madduramma temple crashed onto the vehicle

title: Chief Minister Stalin is not willing to conduct caste census: Palaniswami
content: Pointing out that the DMK govt. did not extend the tenure of the one-man commission formed to collect data on castes, communities, and tribes during the previous AIADMK regime, he alleges that the CM has shown little interest in the issue

title: If Bihar has to change, then government has to be changed, says Congress leader Pawan Khera
content: He lashes out at the Nitish Kumar-led National Democratic Alliance government of Bihar over the issues of development and law and order

title: Pilgrims from Maharashtra, Karnataka make beeline for Srisailam  ahead of Ugadi
content: It is a custom among the devotees of the two States to offer a part of their crop yield to the deities during the Ugadi festivities to be held from March 27 to 31 this year

title: ‘Thiruthu,’ a correctional film festival at Viyyur central jail from March 24
content: International Film Festival Thrissur to host five-day correctional film festival for inmates. The fete aims to promote rehabilitation and social change through the medium of cinema

title: 100-day anti-TB campaign screens 61.4 lakh persons for infection
content: 5,588 new TB cases found in State whose treatment up is being ensured; full report of the campaign will be released on March 24, World TB Day

title: NIA chargesheets four alleged Babbar Khalsa International operatives
content: Chargesheet filed in connection with a grenade attack case in Chandigarh in 2024; two of them are based in Pakistan and United States

title: Court warrant against Bidar official for not submitting report in land-grab case
content: A former gram panchayat president has accused BJP MLA Prabhu Chavan of encroaching upon government land

title: Tiruvarur-Thiruthuraipoondi-Agasthiyampalli railway line energised
content: Electrical Inspector to the Government of India accorded sanction for energisation of the broad gauge section; a test run of an electric locomotive has been conducted

title: Vizag may host ICC Women’s World Cup this year, says ACA president Kesineni Sivanath
content: As of now, it is speculative, and an official communication from the BCCI is awaited, he says, adding that the Port City may also be the venue for a Men’s ODI match in December

title: ‘Women are challenging the status quo in tech and reshaping the tech landscape’
content: A panel discussion titled ‘Breaking Barriers in Tech: Stories of Resilience and Innovation’ was held on Honeywell’s campus in Bengaluru

title: British-built Pallikkunnu CSI Church to be made a heritage tourism site soon
content: Tourism Minister gave directives to the State Tourism Director to prepare a heritage tourism project for the church

title: HBCH&RC experts roped in to study factors behind rise in cancer cases in Balabhadrapuram
content: Over 20 persons are suffering from various cancers in Balabhadrapuram alone, while 19 more have been reported with symptoms of various cancers during the door-to-door surveys

title: Stop destruction of RTI Act, Jairam Ramesh tells Vaishnaw
content: The Congress leader wrote to the IT Minister: “In the interests of transparency and accountability, I would urge you to pause, review and repeal Section 44 (3) of the Data Protection Act, 2023 which destroys the RTI Act, 2005”

title: Extreme weather, climate change hit fishing community in Kerala, says study
content: According to the study, 72.7% of respondents cited a reduction in fish production as the most prominent issue, followed by a potential decrease in overall catch and income

title: Muslim organisations boycott Nitish Kumar’s Iftar over his support to Waqf Amendment Bill
content: The organisations, which have registered their protest include the All India Muslim Personal Law Board, Imarat-e-Sharia, Jamiat Ulama-i-Hind, Jamiat Ahle Hadith, Jamal-e-Islami Hind, Khanqah Mujibia and Khanqah Rahmani.

title: BMTC to launch mobile service vans for bus maintenance
content: The vehicles will be flagged off by Transport and Muzrai Minister Ramalinga Reddy at the BMTC Central Office in Shanthinagar

title: CPI(M) urges Andhra Pradesh government to repeal property tax hike
content: Party’s State secretary V. Srinivasa Rao writes to Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu to take necessary steps to repeal the Municipal Amendment Act 44/2020, which enables the tax calculation of a property based on its capital value instead of the rental value

title: ‘Millet Man of India’ asks farmers to avoid usage of fertilisers
content: Khadar Vali takes a dig at the policy of giving subsidies for fertilisers, and the distribution of rice through the public distribution system on the second day of the three-day Millets Mela—2025 in Anantapur

title: Government integrates urban and rural SHGs
content: The integration of urban SHGs with rural SHGs aims to bridge this gap by leveraging urban markets as distribution channels for rural SHG products; collaboration is expected to create new economic opportunities, boost rural industries and strengthen financial inclusion

title: Kerala Forest department introduces audit framework to assess wildlife mortalities
content: Wild Animal Mortality Audit Framework will involve real-time data collection and centralised digital documentation

title: 81 libraries get laptops, projectors from Ernakulam district panchayat
content: The distribution of new devices marked the first phase of an effort to equip all libraries with modern technology for public access

title: Protest in Afzalpur with body of farmer found dead
content: Agitating farmers keep the body outside the Tehsil office and block the Kalaburagi-Vijayapura State Highway for nearly four hours

title: Andhra Pradesh to roll out support centres for autistic children
content: State granted funds to the tune of ₹3,468.75 lakh under the PM SHRI to establish 125 autism centres for the 2025-26 academic year

title: Noida ‘honour killing’: A blue dupatta for a wedding and a strangulation
content: A 23-year-old woman was allegedly killed by her father and brother, a day after she married her boyfriend in Greater Noida, Uttar Pradesh. Samridhi Tewari reports on how her family allegedly cremated her immediately after her death, and the police have arrested the father-son duo for her murder

title: Panel steps up rehabilitation of rescued children in Tiruchi
content: Around 500 children are rehabilitated at 17 childcare homes monitored by the Tiruchi district administration; a 12-year-old boy was rescued at airport on March 23

title: MP blames Siddaramaiah for Speaker suspending BJP MLAs
content: Demanding the revocation of the suspension order, Jagadish Shettar says that the Chief Minister is behind the Speaker acting in such a manner

title: Women in MNCs at greater risk of TB due to work stress and poor nutrition: Experts
content: Experts note that career-driven professionals, along with homemakers, often prioritise work or family over their health, leading to weakened immunity and higher susceptibility to infections like tuberculosis

title: Chamayavilakku festival begins
content: Festival’s unique temple ritual involves men dressed as women offering prayers to the presiding deity; will be held on March 24 and 25

title: Global study maps tropical forests based on diverse canopy
content: KFRI part of pioneering research that assessed 1,814 sites worldwide that utilised field data and satellite imagery

title: Tiger population in Nagarjunasagar-Srisailam Tiger Reserve pegged at 76
content: The number, as per the annual report for 2024, is excluding 11 cubs; the findings also highlight strong prey base, habitat connectivity, and effectiveness of anti-poaching efforts

title: Why iconise someone who was against India’s ethos, asks RSS general secretary over Aurangzeb’s tomb row
content: Mr. Dattatreya Hosabale said the Sangh never advocated religion-based quota but backed inter-caste marriages

title: Kishan Reddy sees ‘political conspiracy’ behind ‘mudslinging’ against Centre in Chennai meeting
content: Union Minister emphasised that any future delimitation would be carried out in consultation with the States, under the same law introduced by the erstwhile Congress government.

title: 'Nitish Kumar mentally unfit, impossible PM is unaware': Prashant Kishor's big charge
content: Activist Prashant Kishor has questioned Bihar CM Nitish Kumar's mental fitness, demanding his resignation and claiming he is unaware of state affairs. Kishor's comments have intensified criticism ahead of the upcoming elections, despite reassurances from Kumar's allies about his health.

title: Kejriwal returns swinging, calls BJP 'worse than British', hits out at Cong
content: Arvind Kejriwal criticizes both BJP and Congress for neglecting Bhagat Singh and BR Ambedkar’s legacies, alleging collusion between the two parties. At a rally, he highlights BJP's removal of iconic pictures and Congress's silence, labeling BJP’s actions worse than British colonial rule.

title: Turkey crisis deepens: Erdogan's political rival jailed; protests intensify
content: Istanbul Mayor Ekrem Imamoglu, a major opposition figure, was arrested on corruption charges, sparking significant protests across Turkey. Supporters claim the charges are politically motivated to hinder his presidential ambitions, while the government denies interference. The events have drawn international criticism and led to economic instability.

title: Angry investor: 'Musk has just destroyed Tesla's reputation with his ... '
content: Ross Gerber, CEO of Gerber Kawasaki, criticized Elon Musk for neglecting Tesla and causing negative publicity through divisive actions. He suggested Musk should focus solely on Tesla or step down. The company is facing declining sales and worldwide protests, causing significant brand damage.

title: Watch: Vintage Dhoni rolls back the years to dismiss SKY
content: MS Dhoni, at 43, performed a quick stumping to dismiss Mumbai Indians’ captain Suryakumar Yadav in the 11th over. His exceptional reflexes and skillful wicketkeeping were the highlight of the match, contributing to Chennai Super Kings' pressure on Mumbai Indians. This moment showcased Dhoni's enduring prowess and impacted Mumbai Indians' innings significantly.

title: Rohit Sharma equals unwanted IPL record with duck against CSK
content: Rohit Sharma became the second-most capped player in IPL history in Mumbai Indians' season opener against Chennai Super Kings. He also equalled the record for the most ducks in the tournament's history with his 18th duck. Despite this, it was a significant achievement in his IPL journey, which started in 2008 and includes five IPL titles with Mumbai Indians.

title: 'Close all Zerodha accounts ...': Customer message that got CEO into action
content: Sachin Jha was compelled to close his Zerodha account due to a compliance issue when his wife joined a global investment bank. Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath responded promptly, addressing the trust gap with an action plan, although Jha ultimately closed his account.

title: IPL: Kishan becomes SRH's newest hero in record IPL onslaught
content: Ishan Kishan smashed his maiden IPL century for Sunrisers Hyderabad in just 45 balls against Rajasthan Royals, leading the team to a formidable 286/6. His explosive performance included a brutal onslaught on Jofra Archer's bowling, setting up an 85-run partnership with Travis Head and ensuring a comfortable victory for SRH.

title: UPS rules: Central government employees take note!
content: UPS guidelines: The Pension Fund Regulatory and Development Authority (PFRDA) has introduced guidelines for the Unified Pension Scheme (UPS), effective April 1, 2025. This scheme offers central government employees currently enrolled in the National Pension Scheme (NPS) a comprehensive alternative.

title: Trump govt sends 'warning' letter to 10 highest-paid consulting companies
content: The Trump administration is scrutinizing federal consultancies like Booz Allen and Accenture, demanding clear reports on their government contracts and cost-cutting plans. Accenture's stock fell due to reduced US government work. The investigation aims to curb waste and spending in the $759 billion federal contract market, affecting major firms such as IBM and General Dynamics.

title: India imposes anti-dumping duties on five Chinese products
content: India has imposed anti-dumping duties on five products from China, including vacuum flasks and aluminium foil, to protect local industries. These duties, based on recommendations from the DGTR, will be in effect for up to five years and also apply to imports from other countries like Japan, Korea, and Malaysia.

title: Watch: Self-styled prophet Bajinder Singh assaults woman in office
content: CCTV footage reveals controversial preacher Bajinder Singh assaulting individuals, including a woman with a child, sparking outrage. Singh is also under investigation for sexual harassment following a complaint by a 22-year-old. Despite his significant social media following, Singh's history of legal issues raises serious concerns.

title: Rohit hits another milestone before taking field in IPL 2025
content: Rohit Sharma has achieved the distinction of becoming the second-most capped player in IPL history with his 258th match appearance. He surpassed Dinesh Karthik and now only trails MS Dhoni. Rohit's IPL journey has been marked by his significant contributions both as a batsman and leader, helping Mumbai Indians secure five IPL titles.

title: Akhilesh Yadav defends Ramjilal Suman's 'Rana Sanga traitor' remark
content: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav defended MP Ramjilal Suman's remark calling Rana Sanga a "traitor," arguing that referencing historical events should not be problematic. Suman had made the comment while criticizing BJP's labeling of Muslims as Babur's descendants. This has sparked controversy with BJP accusing SP of insulting the Rajput and Hindu communities.

title: Centre pushes for energy-efficient cooling as power demand soars
content: Bureau of Energy Efficiency has urged air-conditioner manufacturers to accelerate the adoption of BEE 5-star-rated models which could yield significant benefits, including up to 60% energy savings, reduced peak power demand, enhanced grid stability and energy security

title: Kerala govt. clears ₹52.12 crore power supply proposal for landslide-hit regions and model townships in Wayanad
content: As per the DPR, ₹22.52 crore will be spent on restoring supply to the Chooralmala disaster-affected region, ₹23 crore on drawing supply to the proposed townships and ₹6.5 crore on the SCADA-controlled underground cable network and allied facilities

title: In the long term, human-led creativity will retain potential despite AI disruption, says advisor to DST
content: Despite the high levels of automation, many functions, including software code generation, will require a degree of human oversight, says Shashi Shekhar Vempati, Chairperson of the Apex Advisory at the Department of Science and Technology

title: More than 400 Hollywood celebrities send complaint letter against Google, OpenAI
content: Over 400 Hollywood celebrities, including Ben Stiller and Paul McCartney, have signed an open letter to the Trump administration opposing efforts to weaken copyright protections for AI training. They argue such changes would harm the creative industry, which supports millions of American jobs and significant economic contributions.

title: Record! SRH score second highest IPL total; Kishan slams ton
content: Sunrisers Hyderabad set an imposing total of 286/6 against Rajasthan Royals in IPL 2025, nearly breaking their own record. The innings was highlighted by Ishan Kishan's unbeaten 106 off 47 balls. Supported by key contributions from Travis Head and others, SRH's relentless batting continues to dominate, underscoring their formidable prowess in the league.

title: Meerut murder case: Muskan Rastogi seeks govt defense counsel as family cuts ties
content: Muskan Rastogi, accused of murdering her husband with her lover, seeks a government-appointed lawyer after her family withdrew support. The couple, struggling in jail, exhibit signs of drug withdrawal. Deceived by messages after the crime, the murder was revealed on March 18. Muskan's family demands the death penalty.

title: Pressure on Gill? Phillips says 'you don't get more pressure than playing for India'
content: Captain Shubman Gill faces high expectations in IPL 2025 after a disappointing 2024 season for Gujarat Titans. Glenn Phillips emphasises that team performance isn't solely about the captain, noting Gill's experience with high-pressure situations for India. Phillips and his brother, Dale, are renowned for their exceptional fielding skills, attributed to genetics and dedicated practice.

title: Pope Francis makes first public appearance in 5 weeks
content: Pope Francis made his first public appearance in over five weeks from the Gemelli Hospital balcony after battling severe pneumonia. He thanked the crowd and is advised to avoid large gatherings for two months. While his ability to attend upcoming events remains uncertain, he is determined to continue his papacy.

title: Jofra Archer records most expensive spell in IPL history
content: Rajasthan Royals pacer Jofra Archer set an unwanted IPL record by conceding 76 runs in his four-over spell against Sunrisers Hyderabad. This performance is now the most expensive in IPL history. SRH's Ishan Kishan scored a rapid century, leading his team to a huge total of 286 for 6, the second-highest in IPL history.

title: US removes $10m bounty on Taliban's Sirajuddin Haqqani: Report
content: The United States has lifted its bounty on Sirajuddin Haqqani, the Taliban's interior minister, as well as bounties on Abdul Aziz Haqqani and Yahya Haqqani. This development coincided with the Taliban's release of American prisoner George Glezmann.

title: Shekhar Kapur vs OTT censorship on 'Bandit Queen': Battle for creative control
content: Shekhar Kapur criticized an OTT platform for streaming an edited version of his film 'Bandit Queen' without his consent, raising concerns about creative control. Filmmakers like Hansal Mehta and Tigmanshu Dhulia supported Kapur, emphasizing the ethical issues of post-release edits. The debate highlights the need for clearer guidelines and protections for directors in the digital streaming era.

title: 'Demanding injections': How Saurabh Rajput murder accused are spending nights in jail
content: Undertrials Muskan Rastogi and Sahil Shukla remain in separate barracks at Meerut District Jail, experiencing severe withdrawal symptoms from drug addiction. Muskan is accused of murdering her husband, Saurabh Rajput. Investigations reveal the couple’s long-term drug use and Sahil’s involvement with black magic.

title: New Zealand hand Pakistan their biggest T20I defeat to clinch the series
content: New Zealand clinched a series victory by defeating Pakistan by 115 runs in the fourth T20I. The hosts set a challenging target of 220/6 and bowled out Pakistan for 105, with Jacob Duffy and Zak Foulkes leading the attack. Finn Allen's rapid fifty and Michael Bracewell's unbeaten 46 boosted New Zealand's innings.

title: People with invader mindset are a threat to India: RSS' Dattatreya Hosabale
content: RSS general secretary Dattatreya Hosabale has identified individuals with an 'invader mindset' as a threat to India and criticized the glorification of figures like Aurangzeb. He emphasized that religion-based reservations are unconstitutional and opposed by Dr BR Ambedkar's principles.

title: Ajit holds closed-door meet with NCP(SP) neta, Sharad Pawar peeps in
content: Jayant Patil met NCP chief Ajit Pawar for a closed-door discussion at the VSI, which was attended by Sharad Pawar. Ajit Pawar downplayed speculations about Patil quitting his party, stating that their meeting was focused on discussing the implementation of artificial intelligence in agriculture.

title: Indian-origin man, 24-yr-old daughter shot dead in US store; suspect arrested
content: A tragic shooting in Virginia claimed the lives of Pradeep Patel and his daughter Urmi, causing shockwaves in both the Gujarati community in the US and their native village in Mehsana. Pradeep, 56, died on the spot while Urmi succumbed to injuries two days later; the suspected shooter has been arrested.

title: BSEB Bihar Board Result 2025 dates announced? Check details here
content: The Bihar School Examination Board (BSEB) has reportedly announced the Class 10 and 12 result dates. Class 10 results will be declared on April 5, 2025, and Class 12 results on March 27, 2025. Students can check results at secondary.biharboardonline.com. The exams were conducted from February 1-15 (Class 12) and February 17-25 (Class 10).

title: Himachal halts overnight bus parking in Punjab over pro-Khalistani slogans, attacks
content: In response to attacks on Himachal Pradesh buses in Punjab, Deputy Chief Minister Mukesh Agnihotri announced that the buses will not be parked overnight in Punjab until the AAP government ensures their safety. The vandalism involved smashing windshields and scribbling pro-Khalistan slogans. Measures are being taken to safeguard buses and passengers, including potentially suspending some routes.

title: Second husband uses wife’s divorce decree to annul marriage in Gujarat
content: A Rajkot woman's second marriage was declared null after her husband proved her first marriage was still valid at the time of her second marriage. He argued that their caste did not recognize customary divorce, which she used to end her first marriage. The Gujarat High Court overturned the family court's dismissal of his suit, deeming it legally unsound.

title: 4 dead, 17 injured in bus-taxi collision on Srinagar-Sonamarg road
content: A road accident on the Srinagar-Sonamarg road in Ganderbal district of Jammu and Kashmir resulted in the deaths of four people and injuries to 17 others. The collision between a bus and a taxi, which bore a Madhya Pradesh registration number, occurred at Gund. The injured are undergoing treatment, and officials are determining further details.

title: Watch: Rohit Sharma fulfils fangirl's dream by signing customised jersey
content: Ahead of the IPL 2025 clash between MI and CSK, Rohit Sharma shared a heartwarming moment with a young fangirl who tried to touch his feet. Humbly stopping her, Rohit signed her customised jerseys with respect for the national flag and posed for a photo. MI look to recover from a poor 2024 season, with Suryakumar Yadav leading against CSK.

title: 'Prison-like conditions': Kerala student in coma for 3 months after harassment, dies
content: A third-year nursing student, Chaithanya Kumari, 20, who was in a coma following a suicide attempt, died on Saturday. She faced alleged harassment by the hostel warden, which led to the tragic incident. The warden has been accused of mental harassment and a case has been registered.

title: Women Supreme Court judges serve 1 year less than men, finds report
content: Despite more women entering the legal profession, the CLPR report reveals systemic gender discrimination in judicial appointments in India. Women judges serve shorter tenures and are appointed at older ages, hindering their rise to senior ranks, including the Supreme Court collegium.

title: INDIA must appear to be a ‘bloc and not un-bloc' itself in public domain: Kapil Sibal
content: Rajya Sabha MP Kapil Sibal urged the INDIA alliance to present a united front with a formal structure and clear spokespersons. Highlighting internal conflicts, he emphasized the necessity for a cohesive policy approach to effectively counter the BJP. Sibal also discussed potential challenges and political implications related to upcoming issues like the Waqf (Amendment) Bill and delimitation.

title: Fire dept chief denies report of 'no cash' found at Delhi HC judge Varma's home
content: Delhi fire department chief Atul Garg denied reports claiming no cash was found during firefighting at Justice Yashwant Varma's residence. The fire incident on March 14 involved two fire tenders, and suspicions of Delhi Police personnel led to further investigation, with authorities remaining tight-lipped about the recovered contents.

title: 'His tutor should be changed': BJP takes a dig at Rahul over 'merit' remark
content: BJP MP Ravi Shankar Prasad criticizes Rahul Gandhi for questioning India's merit system and doubts Gandhi's own qualifications for his role as the leader of the opposition. Gandhi's remarks highlighted the biases in India’s education and bureaucratic systems against Dalits, OBCs, and tribals.

title: David Warner hits out at Air India: 'No pilots, waiting for hours'
content: Ex-Australia cricketer David Warner expressed frustration on Saturday about boarding an Air India flight without pilots, leading to hours of delay. The airline attributed the issue to weather-related disruptions at Bengaluru airport, which delayed the flight crew. Air India apologised for the inconvenience, explaining that crew delays affected the flight's departure.

title: Saurabh murder case: Muskan, her lover grappling with 'drug withdrawal symptoms’
content: Incarcerated for the murder of her husband, Muskan Rastogi and her lover Sahil Shukla, both battling severe drug withdrawal symptoms, are closely monitored in Meerut jail. Their request to stay near each other was denied. Police investigations reveal their long-term drug use and possible obsession with black magic. Efforts are on for a fast-track trial.

title: Iconic Twitter logo, blue bird 'Larry' auctioned for nearly $35,000
content: Twitter's former blue bird logo was sold for $34,375 in an RR Auction event after Elon Musk rebranded Twitter to X. The 560-pound sign, known as "Larry," was part of a broader auction of Twitter memorabilia and tech collectibles, including a $375,000 Apple-1 computer and an $87,514 first-generation iPhone.

title: ‘Wife watched husband live for 44 min’: Man livestreams suicide in MP
content: A 27-year-old man from Rewa district died by suicide while live-streaming his final moments on social media, accusing his wife and mother-in-law of driving him to the act. The police have arrested the wife's mother and the wife for abetment to suicide after discovering the wife's involvement.

title: ‘Effects of antipathy’: Is US seeing a drop in tourist arrivals?
content: US tourism faces a decline, with international visitors projected to drop by 5.1% in 2025. Factors include policies by President Trump, a strong dollar, and rising global tensions. The tourism sector risks losing $64 billion as a consequence, impacting major upcoming events.

title: ‘No proof of forced entry’: Key details from Delhi HC CJ’s report on judge cash row
content: The Supreme Court has initiated an inquiry into the fire at Justice Yashwant Varma's residence, where burnt currency notes were allegedly found. Justice Varma denies any wrongdoing, calling the allegations a conspiracy. A three-member panel will investigate the case and review forensic findings.

title: Why Micah Parsons isn't the only player Dallas needs to extend this offseason
content: three key members of the Cowboys' 2022 draft class are in position to sign extensions . first-rounder Tyler Smith has his fifth-year option for 2026 at a cost of $21.27 million . the 49ers will look different in 2025 .

title: All-Star to architect: Buster Posey's plan to rebuild the Giants
content: buster Posey is six days shy of his 38th birthday and less than six months removed from a job few people of his stature have ever taken on . he has a different role: to methodically guide them there, inch by inch, meeting by meeting, transaction by transaction . "as a player, I would come in every day and have a list in my mind of what I wanted to accomplish," he says .

title: Men's NCAA tournament: Live updates as UConn looks to keep hopes of three-peat alive
content: the first day of the second round is over, and it's time to find out the remaining eight men's teams that will play in the second weekend . will the Duke Blue Devils and Florida Gators join Houston and Auburn to see all four no. 1 seeds move on? will the uConn Huskies continue their own streak of deep runs, ending the Gators'?

title: Men's championship odds: Duke, Florida clear co-favorites
content: The 2025 NCAA men's basketball championship game will be played April 7 at the Alamodome in San Antonio.  Tops seeds  Duke ,  Florida ,  Auburn  and  Houston  are the favorites while two-time defending champions  UConn  opened at 125-1 to three-peat. The initial 68-team field was announced Sunday March 16 and has now narrowed to 24 teams as we begin day two of the second round of the tournament. Second round: March 22 and 23 Sweet 16: March 27 and 28 Elite Eight: March 29 and 30 Final Four: April 5 Championship game: April 7 Here are odds for each school to win the men's college basketball championship, along with their odds to reach the Elite Eight, Final Four and the championship game. Odds are accurate as of publication time.  For the latest odds, go to  ESPN BET .

title: Top free agent Stefon Diggs visits New England: Could it be a good fit?
content: the Patriots traded for veteran receiver Randy Moss in 2007 . some wondered how he would fit into the team's culture . the story comes to mind in the wake of a visit to a free agent last week . diggs is an equal to Moss as a player .

title: Mount St. Mary's HC Donny Lind and son reflect on tourney run
content: mount St. Mary's Mountaineers coach Donny Lind has had his son, Silas, with him for much of this season . the elder says he's enjoyed missing school, playing with his friends on the court . "it's been a blast to be able to bring him with me," he says .

title: Haaland scores in 5-0 Norway rout to start WCQ
content: Erling Haaland scored in a 5-0 rout at Moldova on sunday . he leads a team featuring arsenal midfielder Martin degaard . the Scandinavian side is favored to win the 2026 tournament in the united states .

title: Jameis Winston signing sets up Giants' next -- and more significant -- QB move
content: jameis Winston is a notable name with a well-traveled résumé . he could have played his way into a starting job with the New Orleans Saints or Cleveland Browns . the Giants aren't committed to him long term, but they can move on after this season .

title: NCAA title test: Which women's icons got it done -- and is Paige Bueckers next?
content: Paige Bueckers is the ultimate stage for college basketball stars to cement legacies . women's players must either graduate or turn 22 before heading to the WNBA . despite the setbacks, she reached 2,000 career points in the fewest games in program history .
